titleStmt.title: Acts made in the first Parliament of our most high and dread soveraign Charles, by the grace of God King of Great Britane, France, and Ireland, defender of the faith, &c. Holden by himself, present in person, with his three estates, at Edinburgh, upon the 28 day of June, 1633.
Laws, etc.
titleStmt.author: Scotland.
Hay, John, Sir, 1578-1654.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Evan Tyler, printer to the Kings most excellent Majestie,

notesStmt.note: Edited by Sir John Hay, whose name appears on I1v.
The imprint date is false; actually published between 1640 and 1651 (Wing).
Running title reads: The first Parliament of King Charles.
With four final leaves of tables; the last leaf is blank.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
